etymology.description: semantic: 玉 ‘jade’ + phonetic: 見; simplified as 見 → 见.
etymology.interpretation: Left-side 玉 contributes a semantic hint (shine/valuable object), while 見 provides the sound and the idea of ‘seeing’, yielding the sense of something becoming visible or present. In the simplified form, 見 was replaced by 见 without altering pronunciation or core meaning.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction by replacing the phonetic component 見 with its simplified form 见, following the systematic simplification of 見-based characters while keeping sound and meaning.

examples.chinese: 现在开始吧(現在開始吧)。
他突然出现在门口(他突然出現在門口)。
examples.english: He suddenly appeared at the doorway.

examples.chinese: 这个现象很常见(這個現象很常見)。
